value indicating the byte offset in the streamed file at which the audio data starts.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Uniquely identifies an audio file stream property.
Writes bytes of audio data to an audio file.
Writes packets of audio data to an audio data file.
A

value indicating the number of bytes of audio data in the streamed file. This property is valid only if the number of bytes for the entire stream is known from the data parsed in the header. For some kinds of streams this property may have no value.
A
value indicating the number of packets of audio data in the streamed file.
Obtains the packet number corresponding to a byte number. Pass an
structure with the
field filled in, and values are returned in the
and
fields. If the
value is an estimate, then the
value will be set in the
field.
An
structure.
An
structure describing the format of the audio data in the stream.
An
value indicating the byte offset in the streamed file at which the audio data starts.
A four-character code that identifies the audio data format.
To support formats such as AAC with SBR where an encoded data stream can be decoded to multiple destination formats, this property returns an array of
structures (declared in
)â€”one for each of the destination formats. The default behavior is to return an
structure that has the same
structure as that returned by the
property.
Obtains the packet number corresponding to a frame number.
A pointer (
) to a magic cookie. For audio file types that require a magic cookie before packets can be written to a file, you should get this property value before calling the
or
functions.
A
value indicating the maximum packet size of the data in the streamed file.
A
value indicating the theoretical maximum packet size in the streamed file. This value is useful for determining minimum buffer sizes, for example.
An
structure.
Obtains the byte number corresponding to a packet number. Pass an
structure with the
field filled in, and a value is returned in the
field. The
field of the
structure is ignored. If the
value is an estimate, then the
value will be set in the
field.
Obtains the frame number corresponding to a packet number.
